definition: article/commodity/product/goods/kind/grade/rank/character/disposition/nature/temperament/variety/to taste sth/to sample/to criticize/to comment/to judge/to size up/fret (on a guitar or lute)

sentences.english: I think that a luxury is nothing but an indulgence to showoff one's wealth.
sentences.chinese: 我想奢侈品只是用来彰显自己的财气罢了。

sentences.english: How did you think about"Luxe Pack in Green" area?
sentences.chinese: 您认为“奢侈品包装的绿色革命”特区的展示如何？
假贵族喜欢假冒的奢侈品。

sentences.english: Some luxury companies recruit for sales trainees at China's top universities.
sentences.chinese: 部分奢侈品公司在中国最好的大学中招募销售实习生。

sentences.english: Once in a while, we tend to indulge in sheer luxury.
sentences.chinese: 我们偶尔会沉溺于那些纯粹的奢侈品。

sentences.english: The quota on luxury item have is revoke.
Many of them are well-off Americans who patronize luxury shops.
sentences.chinese: 许多像他这样的人都比较富裕而且喜欢购买奢侈品。

sentences.english: Moscow buys over 80 percent of Russia's luxury goods.
sentences.chinese: 莫斯科奢侈品销售量占全俄的80%多。

sentences.english: The study also sought to measure buyers' guilt when indulging in luxury acquisitions.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究还想了解消费者购买奢侈品时的内疚感。

sentences.english: Price comparison when shopping is also valuable, even (and sometimes especially) when buying expensive items.
sentences.chinese: 在购物时也要学会货比三家，即使是买奢侈品时。

sentences.english: Chocolate became a luxury only the aristocracy could afford.
sentences.chinese: 于是巧克力成了只有贵族才能吃得起的奢侈品。

sentences.english: Is the sole aim of most Americans to make money and posses luxuries which could be called excessive?
sentences.chinese: 赚钱和拥有众多奢侈品是否美国人唯一的追求呢？

sentences.english: The quota on luxury item have is revoked.
Instead, the company includes diamond jewelry in its luxury fund.
sentences.chinese: 相反，公司将钻石包括在奢侈品基金下。

sentences.english: But some luxury goods also serve a practical function.
sentences.chinese: 当然，有的奢侈品也有实用功能。

sentences.english: The room temperature superconductor has been the "snark" of modern materials science...
sentences.chinese: 常温超导体早已成为现代科学材料中的奢侈品。

definition: famous watch (i.e. expensive brand of wristwatch)
